China and Philippines sign offshore oil and gas deal  Financial Times

China and the Philippines moved closer to a controversial deal on oil and gas development in the South China Sea on Tuesday, in the latest sign of a deepening rapprochement between the two countries. item.title: ‘Don’t pay for these idiots’: Duterte wants Filipinos to ditch Catholic mass, pray home instead - RT
item.description:
‘Don’t pay for these idiots’: Duterte wants Filipinos to ditch Catholic mass, pray home instead  RT

item.description:
China's Xi arrives in Manila with focus on infrastructure pledges  Al Jazeera English

Xi Jinping arrived in the Philippines on Tuesday for the first state visit by a Chinese president in 13 years, with the administration of Rodrigo Duterte under pressure to show there is value in its "pivot" to China. item.title: Philippines court defers Marcos arrest after her graft conviction - Reuters
item.description:
Philippines court defers Marcos arrest after her graft conviction  Reuters

Former Philippines first lady Imelda Marcos was granted bail on Friday after convincing a court to defer her arrest following her conviction a week ago for massive graft. A move by the Philippines Justice Department to charge investigative news site Rappler with tax evasion is being seen as a thinly disguised attempt to stifle press freedom in the Southeast Asian country. item.description:
Rappler chief Maria Ressa says tax evasion charges won't silence news site's journalists  CNN

Maria Ressa, the CEO of the Philippine news website Rappler, said Monday that her reporters would not be silenced in the face of tax evasion charges, telling CNN that "journalists are more important today than ever." Chinese President Xi Jinping kicked off a packed itinerary in Papua New Guinea Friday at the start of a tour which marks Beijing's latest diplomatic foray into a region once considered outside of China's sphere of influence. item.description:
Philippines human rights lawyer shot dead on Negros island  Al Jazeera English

item.description:

A Philippine court found former first lady Imelda Marcos guilty of corruption and ordered her arrest on Friday in a rare conviction among many cases that she plans to appeal to avoid jail and losing her seat in Congress.
